snippet: “Mr. Burns, a Post-Electric Play,” by Anne Washburn at Playwrights Horizons, imagines a postdisaster world where the retelling of a “Simpsons” episode helps create security and culture.
abstract: Ben Brantley reviews Playwrights Horizons production of Anne Washburn play Mr Burns, a Post-Electric Play, directed by Steve Cosson and starring Quincy Tyler Bernstine.
lead_paragraph: “Mr. Burns, a Post-Electric Play,” by Anne Washburn at Playwrights Horizons, imagines a postdisaster world where the retelling of a “Simpsons” episode helps create security and culture.

headline.seo: ‘Mr. Burns, a Post-Electric Play,’ at Playwrights Horizons
headline.main: Stand Up, Survivors; Homer Is With You
headline.print_headline: Stand Up, Survivors; Homer Is With You
headline.kicker: Theater Review | 'Mr. Burns, a Post-Electric Play,'
